word.entryDescription: to give something in return for money
word.entryExample: Britain was the first country to sell stamps.

word.entryDescription: shaped like a half of a circle
word.entryExample: Each of the three semi-circular canals in the inner ear is responsible for a different direction of movement.

word.entryDescription: a house that is connected to another house only on one side
word.entryExample: We live in a semi-detached house in the suburbs.

word.entryDescription: a demonstration to teach others; a class on some subject, given as a form of training
word.entryExample: If we’re interested in doing seminars, we have to find our own models.

word.entryDescription: to make a letter, message, object, information, etc go from one place to another
word.entryExample: Will you send me a text when you get on the train?

word.entryDescription: to send something somewhere by post
word.entryExample: Did you send off your job application?

word.entryDescription: a sensory system located in the inner ear reponsible for registering the orientation of the head
word.entryExample: They are going to push their sense of balance to the limits.

word.entryDescription: a punishment given in court after somebody has been found guilty
word.entryExample: The judge will deliver the sentence tomorrow.

word.entryDescription: to officially state the punishment given to someone who comitted a crime
word.entryExample: The arsonist was sentenced to five years in prison.

word.entryDescription: a set of programmes that are related and are meant to be watched in sequence
word.entryExample: Do you have a favourite TV series?

word.entryDescription: bringing food and drink to people
word.entryExample: The service was a bit slow. We waited 20 minutes for our dessert.

word.entryDescription: to start a journey
word.entryExample: I think we need to set off in 10 minutes.

word.entryDescription: to establish, arrange or prepare
word.entryExample: We want to set up our own business.

word.entryDescription: the environment in which a situation is set; the background.
word.entryExample: This is a photo of an old cottage in a beautiful setting.

word.entryDescription: to end a discussion, disagreement or argument by reaching a decision or agreement, or by discovering a fact
word.entryExample: The dispute was settled out of court.

word.entryDescription: an agreement which officially ends a dispute
word.entryExample: After hours of negotiation a settlement was finally reached.

word.entryDescription: the number 7
word.entryExample: I'm seven years old.

word.entryDescription: the number 17
word.entryExample: My sister is seventeen.

word.entryDescription: in the position of number seven when we count
word.entryExample: Sunday is the seventh day of the week.

word.entryDescription: more than a few but not many
word.entryExample: He usually eats fish several times a week.

word.entryDescription: when you are strongly forced to do something
word.entryExample: Because of government cuts, we are under severe pressure to deliver our usual high level of care.

word.entryDescription: a person (especially a celebrity) who is considered by many people to be very sexually attractive
word.entryExample: She has become Hollywood's newest sex symbol.

word.entryDescription: used to make a suggestion or to ask a question that you want someone else to decide about
word.entryExample: Shall we book our family holiday?

word.entryDescription: we use 'shall' to ask for suggestions
word.entryExample: Shall I help you with this exercise?

word.entryDescription: the form that something has
word.entryExample: The toys have shapes of different animals.

word.entryDescription: a large sea fish that usually has very sharp teeth and a triangular fin on its back
word.entryExample: Are there any sharks in the water?

word.entryDescription: cutting hair off your face (or body)
word.entryExample: Although it’s not something they like to shout about, men put a great deal of effort into grooming themselves – be it shaving, moisturising or even applying a little make up.

word.entryDescription: a small building, often wooden and found in a garden, which is used to store things
word.entryExample: Dad's building a shed in the garden.

word.entryDescription: a farm animal that people keep for its thick wool and meat
word.entryExample: Sheep live on a farm.

word.entryDescription: a large thin piece of material that you put on a bed
word.entryExample: She made sure the patients had clean bandages and sheets.

word.entryDescription: the length of time that food, etc., can be kept in a shop before it is too old to be sold
word.entryExample: This meant that food could be protected from damage and dirt on its journey and could be preserved for longer, extending its shelf life.

word.entryDescription: a job in which you are responsible for ensuring that shelves and product displays in retail stores remain stocked
word.entryExample: Applicants must have previous shelf-filling, merchandising or shop floor assistant experience.

word.entryDescription: a small hard object you find on a beach
word.entryExample: There are some beautiful shells on the beach.

word.entryDescription: a structure designed to protect people from the weather or danger
word.entryExample: Hats are described as shelters because they can protect us from the weather.

word.entryDescription: something that protects part of your body
word.entryExample: A helmet acts as a shield for the head.

word.entryDescription: past simple form of 'shimmer' – to shine with a soft light that seems to be moving slightly
word.entryExample: The moon shimmered on the lake's surface.

word.entryDescription: a large sea boat
word.entryExample: My father works on a ship and he travels all over the world.

word.entryDescription: surprised and upset by something unexpected and unpleasant
word.entryExample: I was shocked when I saw him waiting for me at the airport.

word.entryDescription: one of the hard things you wear on your feet especially when you are outside
word.entryExample: Whose shoes are these?

word.entryDescription: a place where you can buy something
word.entryExample: There are lots of shops on the high street.

word.entryDescription: somebody who works in a shop serving and helping customers
word.entryExample: Let's ask this shop assistant. Where's the menswear section, please?

word.entryDescription: somebody who tries secretly to steal goods from a shop
word.entryExample: The shoplifter was arrested for stealing a packet of biscuits from the supermarket.

word.entryDescription: the crime of trying secretly to steal goods from a shop
word.entryExample: The man was not accused of robbery, he was accused of shoplifting.

word.entryDescription: someone who buys goods from shops
word.entryExample: These items are bought by shoppers that want to support workers in developing countries.

word.entryDescription: a strong bag with handles for carrying a shopper's purchases
word.entryExample: Take a shopping bag with you.

word.entryDescription: a big building containing lots of different shops
word.entryExample: In Shanghai you see apartment buildings next to car parks, shopping centres opposite skyscrapers, and motorways running between them all.

word.entryDescription: a list of items to be purchased
word.entryExample: Write a shopping list before you go out.

word.entryDescription: a group of shops together in a big building
word.entryExample: This town is too small for a shopping mall.

word.entryDescription: a strip of land right next to the edge of a sea or a lake
word.entryExample: There's a path leading down to the shore.

word.entryDescription: a short person or thing is smaller in height than other people or things
word.entryExample: I'm short but my sister is tall.
